entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content:
• Status changed from submitted to AD review

Thanks for this submission. We'll review it in the next standards council telecon, prior to 60-day public comment.

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content: Per the July 8 standards council call, the AD will work with the group on these documents, prior to public comment. The intention is to process #88 and #90 at the same time as #89.

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content:
• Priority changed from Normal to High

The NSI group is meeting in 4 sessions at OGF 39. Can we get the AD input completed in time to be used at this meeting, please?

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content: As with #90, we are awaiting Richard to provide input.

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content: Comment set to co-chairs September 2013

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content:
• File NSI Connection Service Protocol_20_draft22_submitedOGFeditors17dec13.docx added

Richard,

Please find attached NSI CS v2.0 document with changes as per your comments.

We have also added a new section on Service Definitions and revised the Topology representation to improve flexibility.

Guy

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content:
• Status changed from AD review to final review

Thanks, Guy. It looks good. This is now heading for standards council final review, prior to publication.
-- Greg

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content:
• Status changed from final review to AD review
  • Priority changed from High to Normal

Update from the standards council: since the changes from the previous version are substantial, we will instead await a review from the area director. Thanks,
Greg

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content: I have reviewed the updated NSI Connection Service v2.0 doc and sent some comments back to the co-chairs. There are a few formatting matters and some items to clarify, but I think there is only one issue related to the separation of the NSI protocol and the Transport layer (SOAP). They are working though the suggestions and aim to have the doc back to the document process & myself by Friday 10 Jan 14. I propose we release the Friday veraion for public comment.

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content:
• File NSI Connection Service Protocol_20_public_comment.pdf added

Thanks Richard for checking this document in great detail. We have made all of the corrections and clarifications requested in this version of the document. We would appreciate if you could post this version for public comment.

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content:
• Status changed from AD review to public comment
  • Assignee changed from Richard Hughes-Jones to Greg Newby
  • Priority changed from Normal to Urgent

I added a public comment tracker at https://redmine.ogf.org/projects/editor-pubcom/boards/18 -- it is up to Richard, Alan and/or Greg to decide how quickly that can be announced.

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content:
• Assignee changed from Greg Newby to Andre Merzky
  • Priority changed from Urgent to Normal

Richard's message approved this moving to public comment, so I will go ahead & announce. Thanks! Greg

Guy

entry.content: • Status changed from author action to final review

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content:
• Status changed from final review to public comment
  • Assignee changed from Richard Hughes-Jones to Greg Newby

The public comment tracker has been updated with the new document versions (see https://redmine.ogf.org/boards/18/topics/241). Greg, according to Richard this can now really be announced

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content:
• File NSI Connection Service Protocol_20_after_public_comment_v2.docx added
  • Status changed from public comment to AD review
  • Assignee changed from Greg Newby to Richard Hughes-Jones

We received the final versions via email, and I'm putting them in the tracker. Standards council final review will be at the next standards council meeting, around May 27.

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content: • File NSI Connection Service Protocol_20_published.docx added

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content:
• Status changed from AD review to final review

Document recommended for advancement to publication status by area director. Now enters GFSG 2-week final review. Meanwhile we need a copy of the final document uploaded into this tracker, please, so GFSG can have it available for easy reference.

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content:
• Status changed from final review to to be published
  • Assignee changed from Richard Hughes-Jones to Andre Merzky

Per the May 27 standards council telecon, this document is now approved. It will be published as GFD-R-P.212

Andre, would you please attach the final header and push the document to www.ogf.org? Then, I will announce via the wg-all mailing list. Thank you!

And, thanks to the authors/editors for their efforts on this document. It's a valuable addition to the OGF document series.

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content:
• Status changed from to be published to published
  • Assignee deleted (Andre Merzky)
  • % Done changed from 0 to 100

This is published now as GFD.212. The canonical URL is http://www.ogf.org/documents/GFD.212.pdf .

entry.title: Editor - document #89: Proposed NSI Connection Service Protocol v2.0 Recommendation
entry.content:
Forgot to add: Greg, can you please send the announcement?

    Thanks, Andre.
